result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

OFF RECORD: 1:04 PM Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Noah Wesley Garland.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  JA called Dodge Correctional to get DE on the phone.  JA states Dodge Correctional didn't have him scheduled for today so he's unavailable.  Court directs attorneys to go to JA's office and schedule PLEAS, Atty Firkus to have all paperwork filed before hand if DE appears by phone. Includes 21CF881, 22CF451, & 22CF452. bph

ADDRESS INFO for Noah Wesley Garland
Current: Dodge Correctional Institution, PO Box 661, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 09-29-2022)
Prior: 1541 Namekagon #6, Hudson, WI 54016
Pre-trial conference on October 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

4:00 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Noah Wesley Garland appeared by phone.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Noah Wesley Garland.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CF881, 22CF451, & 22CF452. Court questions DE on if he's called the PD's office to see if he is qualified and if he can get an Atty appointed.  DE states he has not had a chance to contact them but is on the list to get a phone call.  Court will schedule this to allow DE a little more time. JA to follow up with PD's office to confirm they received a phone call from DE and are working on appointing an attorney. Adjourned at 4:06 PM. bph
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 28, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

4:23 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Noah Wesley Garland.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CF881, 22CF451, & 22CF452. Court reviews file.  Atty Firkus states he believes he's in Dodge Correctional Facility.  Court suspends further representation at this time. Court received information from JA stating the Court is to call Dodge Correctional Facility.  DE now appears via phone.  Court to send DE notice and PD's phone number to DE. DE to contact PD's office as soon as possible to have Atty Firkus appointed.  Zoom approved for next court date. Adjourned at 4:34 PM. bph
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

NOH (ARGN) returned by PO. Return to sender. Not deliverable as addressed. Unable to forward. olg
Per jail: DE no longer in custody. Not resent, as hearing date has passed. Filed in 22CF379, 22CF881, 22CF451, and 22CF452. olg
Arraignment on September 7, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

8:07 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Becker in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by video for Noah Wesley Garland, Defendant Noah Wesley Garland not in court. Set for ARGN on 22CF451 and 22CF452, STC on 21CF881. INCLUDES 21CF881, 22CF451 and 22CF452.  Court reviews case. Atty. Firkus attempted to contact DE in Pierce County yesterday but was informed that DE had been transported to a different facility. DE is currently at Dodge Correctional Facility. Court notes DE is on cash bond. Order for Transport may be needed if Dodge is unable to coordinate video appearance for DE. Clerk will mail DE's Notice of Hearing in c/o Dodge Correctional Facility. Adjourned: 8:11 AM. kma
Arraignment scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Filed by ADA Rockow. km
Per SRN.  Faxed: Dispatch, Jail, & SCSO. bph

9:32 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Noah Wesley Garland appeared by video, in custody in Pierce Co Jail.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Noah Wesley Garland. Includes 22CF379, 22CF451, 22CF452- all 3 set for PH and 21CF881 (STC).  Court reviews files and questions Atty Firkus on continuing with todays hearing with DE appearing via zoom or if he prefers to reschedule. Atty Firkus requesting clients input. DE would like to proceed with today's hearing but would like to talk to Atty Firkus first.  Court requests everyone to leave court room to allow time for DE to speak with his Atty in private.  Off Record at 9:40 AM. Back on at 9:47 AM.  Atty Firkus is ready to proceed with today's hearings. DE is ready to proceed.  Court finds DE freely and voluntarily waives right to personal appearance for today's proceeding. Court first calls 22CF379- S/T of Officer Charles Welbourn of HUPD.  Direct by ADA Rockow.  ADA Rockow requests for Court to take Judicial Notice of bond in 21CF881.  For purposes of Prelim only court takes Judicial Notice of bond in 21CF881.  Cross by Atty Firkus. Redirect by ADA Rockow.  Recross by Atty Firkus.  Atty arguments.  Court makes statements. Court dismisses 22CF379 without prejudice.  Court calls 22CF451 next.  S/T of Officer Alex Vansomeren of HUPD.  Direct by ADA Rockow.  ADA Rockow requests Court to take Judicial Notice of bonds in 18CF429 & 21CF881.  Court takes Judicial Notice of both bonds for purposes of today's hearing. Cross by Atty Firkus.  Atty Firkus gives argument. For 22CF451- Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court calls 22CF452.  S/T of Sgt Anthony VanSomeren of SCSO.  Direct by ADA Rockow.  ADA Rockow requesting court take Judicial Notice of bonds in 18CF429 & 21CF881.  Court takes Judicial Notice of both bonds for purposes of today's hearing. Cross by Atty Firkus. For 22CF452- Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court will allow DE to appear by zoom for next hearing. Atty Firkus approved to appear by zoom.  Court recalls case at 10:29 AM- Court QUASHES any and all WARRANTS. 
Arraignment scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Letter to Judge Needham from ADA Rockow requesting continuance of 8/9/22 PH.  gll   to kp 8/8

Preliminary hearing on August 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

4:04 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Noah Wesley Garland not in court.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Noah Wesley Garland. Includes 21CF881 set for STC, 22CF0379, 22CF451, & 22CF452- all 3 files set for PH. records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Firkus. km

Includes 22CF451 and 22CF452.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jessie A.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:17 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Noah Wesley Garland in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Noah Wesley Garland for today. Includes 22CF451 and 22CF452. DE qualifies for PD. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Bond argument; bond ordered. Waive speedy prelim. Court sets Preliminary hearing. Adjourned at 1:22 PM.  gll
